fact_check_explanation_title: Pelicans don’t push their spines out of their mouths to cool down
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely-shared meme actually shows birds yawning.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe photo makes it look like husband and daughter aren’t smiling
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture shared by an MP of the family has been digitally altered.

fact_check_explanation_title: Ukraine is not enacting the ‘Great Reset’ with an app
fact_check_explanation_summary: An app available to Ukrainians is how those who’ve lost their job because of the war can get a one-off payment, but it doesn’t mean the introduction of a social …

fact_check_explanation_title: Video doesn’t show Russian and Ukrainian soldiers dancing together after invasion
fact_check_explanation_summary: The clip was uploaded at least six days before the Russian invasion of Ukraine even began.

fact_check_explanation_title: The House of Lords’ daily allowance is about what Universal Credit pays in a month—but peers don’t get it every day
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is the daily allowance for doing parliamentary work in the House. However, not all Lords can claim it, or do.

fact_check_explanation_title: US military deaths didn’t increase by 1,100% last year
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims of a huge spike in deaths are based on faulty data.

fact_check_explanation_title: List of MPs’ crimes isn’t true
fact_check_explanation_summary: This list was supposed to describe the crimes of members of the US Congress more than 20 years ago, and even then it wasn’t verifiable.

fact_check_explanation_title: A video of a failed grenade launcher does not show Russian army
fact_check_explanation_summary: A longer version says it shows the Kenyan army.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of someone smoking in a body bag was taken on set of a music video
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the video shows a ‘dead body in Ukraine’ smoking are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour overstates amount spent on ‘dodgy PPE’ which will be burnt
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Government did write off £8.7 billion spent on PPE—but not all of that relates to equipment which will be burnt.

fact_check_explanation_title: Waitrose is not offering anyone who shares a Facebook post free food
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook page that’s less than a month old claims those who share or comment on a post will receive a £50 box of food.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence quote about photo of child in Nagasaki is true
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post claims to recount an interaction between a US soldier and a child in the aftermath of the bombing of Nagasaki in 1945.
